intro: Siphocampylus lantanifolius, commonly known as the golden cupid, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or arid environments. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
